storyInfo: The Stone of the Sword and the Realmblade become one, temporarily dispelling the Originium storm scourging the battlefield. Morale uplifted, the Victorian alliance begins their counterattack. Logos stays behind to hold back the Sudaram, and prepares to face the Nachzehrer King alone.

attributes.content: A legend is bestowed by the people.
The miracle' you hold already existed before Lugalszargus and I met.
In the depths of the golden sands, explorers who should've been devoured by Catastrophes found safe haven because of this relic.
The relic was forged into a treasured blade, and I carried it along with the young Shah into the endless sands.
I still remember what he said as he rested against my mane beneath the stars––
'It shall have a name, but that name is not mine to give.'
Then, as legends go, he took up the blade and slew the Poltergeist King.
He never returned. Nobody in the land was worthy of giving that sword a name, but a legend was nevertheless born.
The Hero's sword.
It passed through the hands of many kings, until at long last, the Lion with hair as bright as the sun used it to sever the Red Dragon's head.
That story, you're already familiar with, Vina.
Beneath the gleaming blade, the Lion and Dragon ultimately stood side by side and swore an oath to lift the crown together.
Alas, the Hero's sword would slay no more, but would instead be regarded as 'the highest authority'.
It has endured loss and betrayal, yet its brilliance as the symbol of authority has never dimmed.
As Lugalszargus said, you have all sung of it from generation to generation using the name it was given – the Sighs of Kings.
No matter how many times it is reforged, craftsmen will always be able to hear the sighs from within the sword.
They say that it is the kings sighing, lamenting that the glorious empire no longer has enemies worth conquering.

But, it was never the kings who were sighing, but rather the blade itself – a 'miracle' dug out from the golden sands more than a millennium ago. Still, they had the right to give meaning to this sword.
Vina, legends are never told by the heroes themselves.
But, you continued its story. Perhaps in twenty years, the children will sing...
'Alexandrina, the Sword of Victoria, the king who banished the Sarkaz tyrant!'
But, is this the story you want to hear? And, by whose right do you wield this sword?
The king's? The hero's? The peoples'?
(Gawain...)
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Got you, Vina!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You did it, Vina...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The enemy forces encircling the Glorious are retreating before the dukes' forces!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina, hang in there! We'll catch up to you soon enough.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The other dukes' troops have heard news of the Duke of Caster, and are now willing to work together with the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: At least, this is settled before the fighting engulfed Londinium.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Waves of cheering pour through the communicator, each louder than the last.
But the battle continues.
The Sighs of Kings is sheathed within the Stone of the Sword. This is not the end, but merely a beginning.
The Steam Knight... is helping us?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: No, I'd say he only came for the Realmblade.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege's gaze falls on the devastated battlefield, where the Steam Knight went on its warpath.
She looks for the other shadow, but it is nowhere to be found.
Siege grips her hammer tightly and stands before her companions, just like she had done so many times before.
Let's continue the fight.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Until the moment of victory actually arrives.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Realmblade is now active.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Looking up from here, that golden pillar of light is truly breathtaking.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Two decades ago, I first saw the prototype of our Stone of the Sword in the workshop. I have been waiting for this moment ever since.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The light that sunders Catastrophe is no longer a myth, or a heroic tale in alleyways.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Can you envision it? Beneath the shade of this light, our people will no longer need to live in fear of Catastrophe. Our city... will be eternally glorious.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Back then, nobody could have imagined that it would ever be used for this purpose.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: That it would be used in a war started by those barbaric devils, in a ravaged land outside Londinium's gates.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: And... it was done by the hands of my dear brother's orphan, with the aid of the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: For decades, the pedestal has been integral to our strategy in Victoria. What should have become Caster's triumph is now a part of the legacy of the former king's heirs.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Your Grace, we are sorry for betraying your expectations––
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You call it betrayal?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: 'The Glorious was saved, and Victoria was saved.'
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: What is there for me to be disappointed about?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: 'The miracle blooming on the battlefield.' I can even hear my own guards whispering these words.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I believe your 'Sir Suffolk' would share the same opinion, no?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Poet should be acting in accordance with military protocol and retreating with the Realmblade. I will make sure of this––
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: There's no rush. Whether this is a dereliction of duty or a show of loyalty, I shall decide for myself later.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: What's happened has happened, there's no need to worry about the Realmblade's fate for now.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: At least, this isn't necessarily a bad thing either.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Connect to the Exemplars' internal communication channel. Use the alliance line.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Your Grace, there's a risk of being tapped.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Talk less and do your job.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Uhh, whose communication frequency is this? I didn't turn it on––
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Well done, Exemplars.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Well, stuff me?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Your Grace... I thought you'd at least want to meet me in person.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Indeed. Arrangements for that meeting have already been made.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But, after the Realmblade's activation, all intel on the battlefield flowed to me once again.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Opportunities on the battlefield are fleeting, and I was too preoccupied to make use of it.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Siege, what you have accomplished is nothing short of a miracle.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I will reevaluate the role that the Exemplars could play in this war.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: With all due respect, I do not recall opening our communication channels to you.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As of right now, assume your channels are open to all of Victoria's alliance forces.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: They will begin their counterattack by retaking Silverrock Bluffs. Are the Exemplars willing to work with us to create a miracle?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Under the banner of the dukes?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No. The Exemplars cannot, and will not be affiliated with any of the ducal forces. This much, I can assure you.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You must operate as a heroic, independent unit.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Alexandrina, you will come to know... what the Exemplars mean to Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: For now, we undoubtedly stand on the same side.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Take count of your troops. It's time to go.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: That golden light...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Sighs of Kings has taken effect! Siege and the Exemplars have done it!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The situation on the battlefield will finally stabilize.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No longer afflicted by the extreme Originium-dense environment, Victoria's forces will be free to display their full potential.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Military Commission's defeat on the main battlefield is inevitable.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if there are still disputes among the dukes, the overall strength and sustained combat capability of the Victorian Army far eclipses what the Sarkaz can muster. Additionally, Victoria just enjoyed a massive morale boost.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It won't be long until the scales of victory tip towards Victoria.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya, Theresis must have foreseen this when he decided to start this war and fill the trenches of a foreign land with Sarkaz lives.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know, Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But, the more this happens, the more I find myself thinking... What kind of future are they hoping for with so many people thrown away for nothing?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Whatever that might be...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit looks up into the crimson sky.
The storm has not completely halted. The Originium dust swirling in the inverted airflow was only temporarily driven back by the Sighs of Kings, and now rages even more violently than before.
Perhaps they all feel the same way, exhausted just from trying to avert the advent of disaster.
We are only one step from the abyss.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Return from whence you came.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: On the other side of the canyon... is that a crystal cluster that's glowing? Logos...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No matter how many tricks they have up their sleeves, they cannot conceal the blood.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I have removed the Confessarius illusions.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The truth is within reach.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: However...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The shadow is also approaching.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It's cold. Way too cold.
You feel the temperature abruptly change again. Before you know it, you are surrounded once more by a thick, swamp-like fog.
...Sudaram!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: How are there this many...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This is the Nachzehrer's last line of defense in front of the true altar.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This is where Nezzsalem intends to stop us. He does not want us to get any closer.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The lament of the dead fills the air above the battlefield. The Nachzehrers' power... is almost at its very peak.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I have seen the dark clouds of death hanging on the horizon.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If the scorching sun no longer shines, I shall cast the light that pierces the fog here.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: We will...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Cross over to the other side.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Find Salus, and destroy the Blood of Teekaz.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: May the wails of the dead find some quiescence.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos lifts his hand and points to the other side of the canyon.
The congealing mist parts once more.
––'Ferry'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Brief, yet powerful.
Logos seems to both be describing a physical action and uttering an incantation at once.
Originium crystals surge like waves in front of you, stretching all the way to the other side of the canyon until they form a narrow, but stable bridge.
The Nachzehrer King will come for us, and someone has to hold him back.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I will stay behind.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos! Just you, alone?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya, do you still have the package I left with you before? Please give it back to me.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Of course, but––
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Good. With this, there won't be any problems.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Now, go.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Death is pursuing you.
You run with all your might. Maybe it's Amiya who's pulling you, Mon3tr who's dragging you along, or Logos who's pushing you ahead with his incantation––
You hardly even feel your feet touching the ground, but it is as if a thousand bony hands are growing from the mist, trying to latch onto your ankles.
But, the aura of decay fails to reach you in the end. A formless barrier envelops your body, keeping the haze at bay.
You know that Logos's incantation is taking effect. In this moment, the Banshee's 'curse' feels so gentle and warm.
You hear something collapsing, and look in its direction.
The bridge has disappeared, just as quickly and cleanly as when it appeared.
The thick fog once again teems forth, impatient.
You search for that familiar figure, but perhaps because he is too far, or perhaps because the fog is too thick, you cannot see anything at all.

attributes.options: Is Logos in danger?;I'm a bit worried...

attributes.content: Doctor, this is the decision that elite operator Logos made.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: He has the right to make his own tactical judgments based upon the situation at hand. He believes that it would be most beneficial for us to head to the real altar while he faces the Nachzehrers head-on.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Answer me, Doctor. Do you trust him? Do you trust elite operator Logos?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then, you should also trust that he will regroup with us when we are in need.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I understand your desires, scion of decay.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But, death should not be so cacophonous.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Quiet.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The whistle pierces through the thick fog, the incantation spreading in ripples.
Nothing needs to be spoken, nothing needs to be written...
The concealed dead have nowhere to hide. the Sudaram's piercing shriek forms into a longsword that shuttles through the fog.
The words from the whistle quiver, and the Banshee's song resounds––
Within the ancient bloodlines of the Sarkaz, in a valley choked with Originium, amidst the lamentations of countless people who fell in battle...
Flaming shells and witchcraft-imbued rounds intertwine in the skies above the battlefield.
A high-speed battleship crashes into a witchcraft bastion.
A small number of Victorian soldiers charge head-first into an entire squad of Nachzehrers.
The song grows louder and clearer.
When that song reaches its climax, the Nachzehrer soldiers fall into silence and stop attacking one after another, like motionless flags.
They no longer hunt.
At last, death has returned to the land.
War has come to answer your song.
The withered branches retreat in unison. They coil, then lie down, returning once more to their long-deceased forms.
The most hideous and ancient among them still seem to be struggling unwillingly, finally twisting into a scepter.
The tip of the scepter strikes the ground, and a figure emerges from the depths of the dense fog.
Aefanyl... The master of the Elegiac Court.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You chose to stay behind and face me alone.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The corners of his clothes flutter, as the fog disperses.
The Sudaram's white robes are scattered across the dense white hills of withered branches. Longswords lie fallen and shattered, like grass in a forest.
The young Banshee sits sideways atop the hill, his bloodstained fingers plucking at the bone whistle in front of his lips...
Gentle. Melodious.
No, Nezzsalem. There is no such master here.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Only Logos, elite operator of Rhodes Island, dressed to greet our guest.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I have crafted this opus upon death's motif, and I dedicate it to you.
attributes.name: Logos
